img.title: New student registration is still continuing in the Selah School District.
img.alt: New student registration is still continuing in the Selah School District.

span.p: The Selah School District is continuing its new student registration process, including Preschool and Kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 school year. Please read here for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for New Student Registration

img.title: Check out the Selah School District App to see what meals are being served.
img.alt: Check out the Selah School District App to see what meals are being served.

p.strong: Check the Selah School District App to See what’s Cooking!

span.p: There is a new way to see what is on the Meals on the Move menu—simply check out the Selah School District App. For a convenient look to see what is being served daily during Meals on the Move service, access the District’s App and find the “Menu” icon.

a.title: Go to comments for Check the Selah School District App for Meal Service

p.strong: For help with school district student devices or login issues, please contact us at 509-698-8039, or by email at Tech@selahschools.org. I am also at the Selah Middle School Parking lot every weekday from 9am to 10am. Look for a blue Selah School District minivan parked in the southwest corner of the parking lot by where the soccer goals are being stored.

a.title: Go to comments for tech

span.p:
School buildings will be closed for the remainder of the school year. As a result, we need to see that the medication your child may have at school will get home safely.
Please click here to view entire message
En Español

a.title: Go to comments for Medication Pickup

span.em: Hello students, staff and families. I hope you are adjusting somewhat to at-home life and staying healthy during this pandemic that is impacting all of us. I have some news to share that will affect the remainder of the school year.
Today, Governor Jay Inslee officially closed all schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year... Please click here to read full message

a.title: Go to comments for update 4/6

img.title: During school closure, Selah students will be available to collect a free meal.
img.alt: During school closure, Selah students will be available to collect a free meal.

p.strong: We are committed to providing students the nutrition they need.

span.p: While schools are closed, we are offering free meals for all children, regardless of family income.

ul.li: For the extended closure of the school year.
Free meals for children age 18 and younger.
A breakfast and lunch will be provided.
Children must be present for possession of meals.
Nine Bus Routes and two pick-up locations (See link for details).

p.a: Meal distribution details and locations in English and En Español.

span.p: You can also view our Nutrition Services webpage for menu items and more information - Click Here

a.title: Go to comments for Free Meals for Selah Students 2

img.title: The 2020 Census is almost upon us.
img.alt: The 2020 Census is almost upon us.

span.p: Census 2020 is approaching. Being counted as part of the Census is important to educational funding. Please access https://2020census.gov/en for information about the 2020 Census. Please access the following links for additional information.

p.a: Census Information for Children Under Age 5

div.p: Are you new to Selah and need to register your students for school? Do you need to register your student for Preschool or Kindergarten? If yes, then this information is for you!

img.alt: It's Official; 2020-2021 Calendar Set!

div.p: It’s official; the 2020-2021 school year calendar is set! It’s never too early to begin planning for next school year and as part of preparations, the 2020-2021 is officially ready to review.

a.title: Go to comments for It's Official; 2020-2021 Calendar Set!

img.alt: Meals on the Move Resumes Daily Service on April 13!

a.span: Meals on the Move Resumes Daily Service on April 13!

div.p: Beginning on Monday, April 13, the District will resume its daily Meals on the Move Program in full for all Selah children, ages 1-18.

a.title: Go to comments for Meals on the Move Resumes Daily Service on April 13!

img.alt: SHS Students Experience the Thrill of Competition, Virtually!

a.span: SHS Students Experience the Thrill of Competition, Virtually!

div.p: Even as schools have been closed, a group of Selah High School students still experienced the thrill of competition, virtually, and competed in the Washington Technology Student Association competition.

a.title: Go to comments for SHS Students Experience the Thrill of Competition, Virtually!

img.alt: Selah Delegation Advocates for Education

div.p: Selah School District representatives received an up-close look at Washington’s government in action as they visited the State Capital earlier this week as advocates for education.

a.title: Go to comments for Selah Delegation Advocates for Education

img.alt: Keeping the Streak Alive!

div.p: Advancing to the Washington State Knowledge Bowl Tournament is seemingly becoming an annual springtime tradition for Selah High School. After all, next month, Viking Knowledge Bowl competitors will be making the school’s seventh consecutive appearance at the state event.

a.title: Go to comments for Keeping the Streak Alive!

img.alt: Lady Viks are State Academic Champs!

a.span: Lady Viks are State Academic Champs!

div.p: It was a slam-dunk for the Selah High School Lady Viks Varsity Basketball Team after being named Academic State Champions by the Washington Interscholastic Activities Association.

a.title: Go to comments for Lady Viks are State Academic Champs!

img.alt: The "Big Dog" on Campus Makes the News

a.span: The "Big Dog" on Campus Makes the News

div.p: Roy Thomas is the new “Big Dog” on the Selah Middle School campus, as he is serving as the school’s new therapy dog. See what the local media is saying.

a.title: Go to comments for The "Big Dog" on Campus Makes the News

img.alt: Viking Ambassadors Make Connections!

div.p: As the District rolls-out The Viking Promise, its strategic priorities for the next five years, a team of student ambassadors are working to make community connections in order to ensure the Promise is kept.

a.title: Go to comments for Viking Ambassadors Make Connections!

img.alt: Melissa Singletary Selected as Robert Lince Kindergarten Principal

a.span: Melissa Singletary Selected as Robert Lince Kindergarten Principal

div.p: At the end of this school year Melissa Singletary’s tenure as a first-year assistant principal at John Campbell Primary will have been short-and-sweet; 366 days to be exact. That is because she has recently been named the principal of the Robert Lince Kindergarten campus, which will open its doors next fall.

a.title: Go to comments for Melissa Singletary Selected as Robert Lince Kindergarten Principal

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.strong: Welcome to the Selah School District—Home of the Vikings!

span.p: In Selah, our school district is an important entity in the community and works with the City, local businesses, and various organizations to build a stable education system which helps develop a strong community overall. Selah patrons have a solid reputation of supporting their schools.

The Selah School District serves approximately 3,500 students and is comprised of the Robert Lince Early Learning Center, John Campbell Primary School, Selah Intermediate School, Selah Middle School, Selah High School and Selah Academy. Additionally, the District has a HomeLink Center as well as other alternative learning opportunities.

Our District is committed to achievement and its core purpose of ensuring high levels of learning for every student. Also, staff and students follow the Viking Way, a culture of achievement where the foundation of the District’s beliefs emphasize that every student is worthy and capable of making meaningful contributions to his or her communities, strong character is at the heart of preparing our students for lifelong success, and in a culture of excellence every student graduates on time prepared for college and career opportunities.

img.alt: Not Even Close to Slowing Down, Selah's Transportation Team Aces State Patrol Inspection!

a.span: Not Even Close to Slowing Down, Selah's Transportation Team Aces State Patrol Inspection!

div.p: Not even close to slowing down, it’s already been a busy spring for the Selah School District’s Transportation Team as it continually works to keep Selah students safe!

a.title: Go to comments for Not Even Close to Slowing Down, Selah's Transportation Team Aces State Patrol Inspection!

img.alt: It's a Big, Green Thumbs-Up for Selah FFA!

a.span: It's a Big, Green Thumbs-Up for Selah FFA!

div.p: It’s a big, green thumbs-up to Selah High School teacher and FFA advisor, Brad Watkins, as he and a team of budding volunteers were at the root of hard work to ensure the school’s FFA plant sale opened for business this year.

a.title: Go to comments for It's a Big, Green Thumbs-Up for Selah FFA!

img.alt: A Quartet of Selah Soccer Players Make Headlines this Spring!

a.span: A Quartet of Selah Soccer Players Make Headlines this Spring!

div.p: Even though the athletic fields and courts are empty this spring, Viking athletes continue to make the sports headlines! Congratulations to a quartet of Lady Viking soccer players who recently scored as they were recognized earlier this spring for their soccer talents from performances this past fall.

a.title: Go to comments for A Quartet of Selah Soccer Players Make Headlines this Spring!
